title: Glastonbury 2020 sell out in an astounding 34 minutes with no headliner officially booked!
text:
Glastonbury 2020 sell out in an astounding 34 minutes with no headliner officially booked!

Cape Town - Glastonbury 2020 tickets have sold out, just over 30 minutes after they went on general sale.

Festival organisers tweeted to say over 2.4 million people had registered for the event, creating "more demand" than ever.

According to The BBC, the festival will be celebrating its 50th year in 2020, and big acts are rumoured to be appearing.

According to The Evening Standard, Taylor Swift, Fleetwood Mac or The Spice Girls could be headlining the main stage.

This year rapper Stormzy headlined the famous Pyramid stage and made headlines for his epic performance.

Emily Eavis, daughter of founder Michael, tweeted: "We have now sold out. Thank you all for your incredible, continued support. Demand was higher than ever, with over 2.4 million people registered. Bring on 2020!"

SEE THAT TWEET HERE:

Compiled in Alex Isaacs. (Sources: The BBC, The Evening Standard, Channel24)
description: Glastonbury 2020 tickets have sold out, just over 30 minutes after they went on general sale.
